poem:
### Political Illusions

In the morning's paper, bold headlines declare,  
a dance of promises and illusions in the air.  
Starmer cries of voters conned,  
as parties whisper, bonds accrue.

Beside the kettle, steam rising slow,  
I ponder these stages, this endless show—  
here in the kitchen, life goes on,  
beyond the headlines, a quieter song.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer claims voters being ‘conned’ by Tories and Reform UK as parties are planning a coalition – as it happened 6.16pm BST Early evening summary Pay rises for NHS staff and teachers must be paid from existing budgets, the Treasury has warned, setting up the potential for strike action. Keir Starmer has claimed that Conservative voters and Reform UK voters are both being “conned” because neither party is being honest about the prospect of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
